metadata.title: CVE-2013-7447 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in the gdk_cairo_set_source_pixbuf function ingdk/gdkcairo.c in GTK+ before 3.9.8, as used in eom, gnome-photos, eog,gambas3, thunar, pinpoint, and possibly other applications, allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a large image file,which triggers a large memory allocation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-7447` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gtk-2.0 - 2.24.29-1ubuntu2
gtk2-engines-pixbuf - 2.24.29-1ubuntu2
gtk2.0-examples - 2.24.29-1ubuntu2
libgail-common - 2.24.29-1ubuntu2
libgail18 - 2.24.29-1ubuntu2
libgtk2.0-0 - 2.24.29-1ubuntu2
libgtk2.0-bin - 2.24.29-1ubuntu2
libgtk2.0-common - 2.24.29-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

eog - 3.18.1-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gtk+2.0 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.24.29-1ubuntu2').
gambas3 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
pinpoint package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
eog package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.18.1-1ubuntu2').
